page.title: 09ROSECROFT FARM
page.content: The area is low-lying and level, with about 70% arable land and the rest pasture land. Crops grown include barley and sugar beet. The fields are bordered by hawthorn hedges and drained into deep ditches which have become very overgrown. There is a large variety of plants growing in and around the ditches, including nettles, cow parsley, rosebay willowherb, convulvulous and poppy. Many of the ditches have small trees growing in them, and some of the hedges have large trees growing in them. These include sycamore, elm, beech, oak, ash and silver birch. A tarmac local traffic road called Bull Lane runs from the south-east corner of the area in a diagonal direction. Rosecroft Farm is situated to the east of the road in the north-east corner of the area.
